metadata.title: CVE-2019-7635 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has aheap-based buffer over-read in Blit1to4 in video/SDL_blit_1.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-11
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
libsdl1.2 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-5').
libsdl2-image package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-1').
sdl-image1.2 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-11').
